inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention, but is able to walk with difficulty

inclusion.criterion: Have pathologically proven GB, gliosarcoma (WHO IV), or anaplastic astrocytoma (WHO III) in recurrence after treatment with bevacizumab
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine

inclusion.criterion: Be at least 14 days from the last administration of bevacizumab
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Have received radiation therapy with concurrent temozolomide
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has undergone field radiation t10-l1 followed by 11 cycles of temozolomide

inclusion.criterion: Have adequate organ and marrow function as follows (all required): ANC ≥ 1500 mm3
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Serum creatinine ≤ 1.8 mg/dL or creatinine clearance > 50 mL/min Bilirubin ≤ 1.5 mg/dL
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) ≤ 2.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Has a history of spontaneous or tumor related cerebral hemorrhage; or has cerebral hemorrhage as determined by the screening FDG PET CT and MRI.
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: Patient has a spinal cord conus mass, but no mention of cerebral hemorrhage

exclusion.criterion: Has the any of the following cardiac history: Active heart disease including myocardial infarction within previous 3 months Symptomatic coronary artery disease Arrhythmias not controlled by medication Unstable angina pectoris Uncontrolled or symptomatic congestive heart failure (NYHA class III and IV)
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

exclusion.criterion: Uncontrolled or severe coagulopathies or a history of clinically significant bleeding within the past 6 months, including any of the following, but not limited to: Epistaxis Hemoptysis Hematochezia Hematuria Gastrointestinal bleeding Spontaneous or tumor related intracranial hemorrhage Known predisposition for bleeding such as von Willebrand's disease or other such condition(s)
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: Patient is a 45-year-old man, no mention of pregnancy or lactation

notes: Unknown life expectancy and organ function. No information on ANC, platelets, hemoglobin, serum creatinine, bilirubin, ALT, AST, PT, INR, PTT.
